School Management System

Tkinter_documented module

Tkinter_documented.add_instructor()[source]

Adds a new instructor to the system with input validation and default values.

Creates an Instructor object from the input fields, applying default values when fields are empty or invalid. Updates the dropdown lists and refreshes the data table after adding the instructor.

Tkinter_documented.add_new_course()[source]

Adds a new course to the system and assigns an instructor if selected.

Creates a Course object from the input fields with default values when empty. If an instructor is selected from the dropdown, assigns the course to that instructor. Updates dropdown lists and refreshes the data table.

Tkinter_documented.add_student()[source]

Adds a new student to the system with input validation and default values.

Creates a Student object from the input fields, applying default values when fields are empty or invalid. Updates the dropdown lists and refreshes the data table after adding the student.

Tkinter_documented.assign_instructor_to_course()[source]

Assigns a selected instructor to a selected course.

Creates a bidirectional relationship between the instructor and course by assigning the course to the instructor and setting the instructor as the course’s instructor. Refreshes the data table to reflect changes.

Tkinter_documented.clear_search()[source]

Clears the search input field and refreshes the data table.

Removes any text from the search input field and displays all records in the data table by calling the refresh function.

Tkinter_documented.delete_selected_record()[source]

Deletes the selected record from the system and updates all related data.

Removes the selected record (student, instructor, or course) from the system and cleans up all related associations. For students, removes them from course enrollments. For instructors, removes course assignments. For courses, removes them from student registrations and instructor assignments.

Raises:

None, but silently handles cases where no record is selected

Tkinter_documented.edit_selected_record()[source]

Edits the selected record in the data table using current input field values.

Retrieves the selected item from the data table and updates its properties based on the corresponding input fields. Supports editing students and instructors by updating their name, age, and email if new values are provided. Refreshes the data table to show updated information.

Tkinter_documented.find_person_by_name(collection, target_name)[source]

Searches for a person in a collection by their name.

Parameters:

  • collection (list) – List of person objects to search through

  • target_name (str) – The name to search for

Returns:

The person object if found, None otherwise

Return type:

object or None

Tkinter_documented.generate_default_id(prefix, collection_size)[source]

Generates a default ID with a given prefix and collection size.

Parameters:

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to use for the ID

  • collection_size (int) – The current size of the collection

Returns:

A formatted ID string

Return type:

str

Tkinter_documented.load_all_data()[source]

Loads all system data from JSON files and reconstructs object relationships.

Reads data from student_records.json, instructor_data.json, and course_catalog.json files if they exist. Reconstructs all objects and their relationships including course assignments, student registrations, and instructor-course associations. Updates dropdown lists and refreshes the data table after loading.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – Silently handled if JSON files don’t exist

Tkinter_documented.perform_search()[source]

Performs a search operation based on the selected criteria and search query.

Searches through students, instructors, and courses based on the selected search type (Name, ID, or Course). Clears the current table display and shows only matching results. If no query is provided, refreshes the entire table to show all records.

Tkinter_documented.populate_dropdown_widget(dropdown, items, attribute_name)[source]

Populates a dropdown widget with items from a collection based on a specific attribute.

Parameters:

  • dropdown (ttk.Combobox) – The dropdown widget to be populated

  • items (list) – Collection of objects to extract values from

  • attribute_name (str) – Name of the attribute to extract from each item

Tkinter_documented.refresh_data_table()[source]

Refreshes the main data table display with all current records.

Clears the existing table contents and repopulates it with all students, instructors, and courses currently in the system. Formats the display to show relevant information including associated courses for students and instructors, and assigned instructors for courses.

Tkinter_documented.register_student_for_course()[source]

Registers a selected student for a selected course.

Finds the selected student and course from the dropdown selections, then creates a bidirectional relationship by registering the student for the course and adding the student to the course enrollment. Refreshes the data table to show updated information.

Tkinter_documented.save_all_data()[source]

Saves all system data to JSON files for persistence.

Exports students, instructors, and courses to separate JSON files. Student and instructor data includes all their properties, while course data includes basic information and instructor associations. Creates three files: student_records.json, instructor_data.json, and course_catalog.json in the current directory.

Tkinter_documented.update_dropdown_lists()[source]

Updates all dropdown widgets with current data from the system.

Refreshes the values in all combobox widgets to reflect the current state of students, instructors, and courses in the system. This ensures that dropdown selections remain synchronized with the available data after additions, deletions, or data loading operations.
